result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan S Laurin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: Def shall notify the DA's Office of any change of address or phone number within five (5) days of such change.  Def shall have quarterly contact with the DA's office via phone or letter.  Def shall have no abusive contact with C.L.  Def shall have no negative contacts with Law Enforcement (excluding traffic citations).  If Def attends counseling and provides verification to the Iron County DA's office that the counselor feels the Def has addressed possible anger management issues, the length of this agreement shall be twelve (12) months.

supervisions.notes: Bond is forfeited and remainder is due within 60 days.  If not paid within 60 days, all available enforcements will be taken.
Defendant shall report by 5:00 p.m. on a Friday and be released at 5:00 p.m. on a Sunday.  Defendant is given until after he has completed Anger Management Program or 6 months to report to jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan S Laurin

records.addlTxt: Invoice from court appointed counsel-approved by Judge.

Defendant Dylan S Laurin in court with attorney Daniel W Johns.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances at 11:55 a.m.  Asks to enter judgment and impose $204.50 inclusive on D.C. in 16CM17.  Asks court to order 3 days ICJ.  Atty Johns addresses court.  Extra time to report is granted.  Def pleads NC to DC/$204.50 to be paid within 60 days.  Def is to report to ICJ after Anger Mgmt program (within 6 months).  Shall report by 5:00 p.m. on a Friday and be released at 5:00 p.m. on Sunday.  Atty Johns also refers to DEJ on new case and states terms.  Court reviews DEJ and approves in entirety.  Count #2 in 17CM26 is dismissed by court-change made in DEJ.  Adj.  klr
